intro: Acinodendron lanatum, commonly known as the woolly acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
